definitions: To release or allow to go out.
To utter a sound, especially a cry or a gasp.
To make a garment or item of clothing larger by undoing a seam.
To rent out (a property or space).
examples: She let out a sigh of relief.
They let out the dog for a walk.
The tailor let out the waist of the pants.
He lets out his spare room to students.
